title: Longan Arillus: A comprehensive review of botany, traditional uses, phytochemistry, pharmacologic activities, pharmacokinetics, quality control, toxicity, and clinical applications.
abstract: Longan Arillus (LA) is the aril of Dimocarpus longan Lour. of the Sapindaceae family, commonly known as Guiyuan, whose first documentation can be traced back to the ancient book "Shen Nong's herbal classic". Since ancient times, LA has been commonly used in combination with other herbs or ingredients to make a variety of formulas and medicinal products, which were used to treat diseases such as insomnia, forgetfulness, neurasthenia, overthinking, fatigue, and deficiency of qi and blood, e.g., "Gui Spleen Tang", "Yu Ling Cream", "An Shen Ding Zhi Pill", etc. AIM OF THE REVIEW: This paper presents a comprehensive review encompassing LA's traditional usage, quality control, botany, phytochemical constituents, pharmacological activities, toxicological profiles, pharmacokinetic properties, and clinical applications. The aim is to provide an extensive overview of the current research landscape, facilitating further exploration and utilization of LA resources.
